intro: Metrosideros anomala, commonly known as the Tahitian flame tree, is a flowering plant native to the Pacific Islands. It is a small to medium-sized tree with distinctive red or orange flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has simple, opposite leaves and produces small, woody fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in coastal areas or disturbed soils. Its rapid growth and showy flowers make it a popular ornamental plant in landscaping.
